pesticide.PPE: Long-sleeved shirt and long pants; Shoes plus socks; Chemical-resistant gloves (e.g., barrier laminate, butyl rubber, nitrile rubber, neoprene rubber, natural rubber, polyethylene, polyvinyl chloride — PVC or Viton, 14–17 mils)

Safety_Information.general_Info: Causes eye irritation. Avoid contact with skin, eyes, or clothing. Avoid breathing dust or spray mist.
Safety_Information.if_In_Eyes: Hold eye open and rinse slowly and gently with water for 15-20 minutes; remove contact lenses, if present, after the first 5 minutes, then continue rinsing; call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Call a poison control center or doctor immediately for treatment advice; have person sip a glass of water if able to swallow; do not induce vomiting unless told to do so by a poison control center or doctor; do not give anything by mouth to an unconscious person.
Safety_Information.if_Inhaled: Move person to fresh air; if person is not breathing, call 911 or an ambulance, then give artificial respiration, preferably mouth-to-mouth if possible; call a poison control center or doctor for further treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing; rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes; call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: Symptoms of Poisoning and Suggested Medical Treatment: The compound does not cause any definite symptoms that would be diagnostic. Contact with the eyes may cause irritation. No specific antidote. Treat symptomatically.
